meanings.definition: To shape or reduce (metal) by hammering or pressure.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith swaged the hot metal into a horseshoe.
meanings.sent2: The workers swaged the metal pipes to fit together perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf swaged the metal into funny shapes when the blacksmith wasn't looking.
meanings.sent4: Her determination swaged her fears into a strong resolve.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of the hammer swaging the metal echoed through the workshop.

meanings.definition: A shaped tool or die used for forming metal.
meanings.sent1: The craftsman used a swaged tool to create intricate designs on the metal.
meanings.sent2: The swaged die was essential for shaping the metal into precise angles.
meanings.sent3: The shiny swaged tool caught the sunlight and sparkled like a jewel.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a swaged tool, shaping ideas into tangible creations.
meanings.sent5: The old swaged die held the history of many metalworking projects within its marks.
